tit.cmt: 用語集に登録されている訳は、「old provincial names」です。

sen.j: 旧国名（きゅうこくめい）は、明治初頭まで使用されていた令制国の名称のことである。
sen.e: An old province name is the name of Ryosei province which had been used until the beginning of Meiji period
Old provincial names are the names of the ryoseikoku (province) that were used up to the early Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 用語集に登録されている令制国の訳は ryoseikoku (province) です。「Ryosei province」ではありません。
sen.e: Old provincial names are the names of the ryoseikoku (province) that were used up to the early Meiji period.

sen.j: 一例を挙げると、琉球は薩摩藩の付庸国（琉球王国）であったが、明治維新に際して令制国「琉球国」を新設の後、1871年に鹿児島県への編入を経て1879年に分割され、沖縄県となった。
sen.e: For example, Ryukyu was the dependent province on the Kagoshima Han (Province), but at the time of Meiji Restoration, Ryukyu Province was newly established, after that it was incorporated into Kagoshima Prefecture in 1879.

For example, Ryukyu was a dependent state of the Satsuma domain (the Ryukyu Kingdom); however, at the time of the Meiji restoration the Japanese government made it 'Ryukyu Province'; and after having been annexed to Kagoshima Prefecture in 1871, Ryukyu was separated from Kagoshimas Prefecture in 1879 and became Okinawa Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 琉球王国が訳されていません。 また、文全体が誤訳です。
sen.e: For example, Ryukyu was a dependent state of the Satsuma domain (the Ryukyu Kingdom); however, at the time of the Meiji restoration the Japanese government made it 'Ryukyu Province'; and after having been annexed to Kagoshima Prefecture in 1871, Ryukyu was separated from Kagoshimas Prefecture in 1879 and became Okinawa Prefecture.

sen.j: 本記事では、過去の地名として参照する近現代の用法を扱う。
sen.e: In this article, we treat the way of using the past province name in modern and present-day eras.
In this article, we will address the issues of how the old provincial names were referred to and were used in the modern times and in our time.
sen.cmt: 「参照する」が訳されていません。
sen.e: In this article, we will address the issues of how the old provincial names were referred to and were used in the modern times and in our time.

sen.j: 国が存在した明治時代初めまでは、令制国を参照のこと。
sen.e: Please refer to the article " Ryosei province " regarding how they used the name of Ryosei province in the era before the beginning of Meiji period..
Refer to the article Provinces of Japan in this encyclopedia for the description of provinces up to the early Meiji period during which the old provinces were existed.
sen.cmt: 不明瞭です。「in this encyclopedia」は必要ないかも知れませんが意味を明確にするために付けました。
sen.e: Refer to the article Provinces of Japan in this encyclopedia for the description of provinces up to the early Meiji period during which the old provinces were existed.

sen.j: 令制国が行政単位として使われなくなってからもその名称と区画は長く用いられてきた。
sen.e: Ever since the word Ryosei province was not sued as the unit of administration, its name and division had been still used for a long time after that.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The name of ryoseikoku (provinces) and the divisions have been used for a long time even after the provinces were ceased to be used as administrative unit.
sen.cmt: スペルミスがあります。 また、「Ryosei province」は登録された用語ではありません。
sen.e: The name of ryoseikoku (provinces) and the divisions have been used for a long time even after the provinces were ceased to be used as administrative unit.

sen.j: しかし明治以降は行政において全くと言ってよい程使用されなくなったため、急速に廃れた。
sen.e: However, after Meiji period the word became obsolete rapidly, because it has not been used at all in administration.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, after the Meiji period the old provincial names were almost never used for administrative purposes; as the result, they rapidly fell into disuse.
sen.cmt: 単数を使っていることに問題があります。
sen.e: However, after the Meiji period the old provincial names were almost never used for administrative purposes; as the result, they rapidly fell into disuse.

sen.j: 現代では、離れたところにある同じ地名を区別する際に用いられたり、府県名が郡名や都市名で代用したものが大半であるため、それで呼ぶことを嫌う場合や地域において用いられている（長野県を県庁所在地である長野市が所在する北信地方以外では意識的に「信濃国」或いは「信州」と呼ぶケースが代表的）。
sen.e: Today, the word Ryosei province had not been used, in order to distinguish the same area names which are located in different places with each other, or in the case that prefectural names are similar to names of their counties or cities within the prefectures, therefore it is necessary to distinguish the areas between prefectures and counties or cities (As a typical example, in Nagano prefecture, persons outside the area near Nagano city usually call their prefecture as Shinano or Shinshu, not Nagano prefecture).

At present, the old provincial names are used in several ways; first, people use them to distinguish the same place names in different places; second, people use them when they do not like to use prefecture names that are taken from a city name or a county name instead of coming up with their own and most prefecture names are settled using such substitution; third, people use old provincial names locally; (a typical example is 'Shinano Province' or 'Shinshu' which are consciously called by people in Nagano Prefecture except in the northern part of Nagano Prefecture where Nagano City is located.)
sen.cmt: 「Ryosei province」は登録されている訳ではありません。 また「had not been used」と否定形が使われていることに問題があります。
sen.e: At present, the old provincial names are used in several ways; first, people use them to distinguish the same place names in different places; second, people use them when they do not like to use prefecture names that are taken from a city name or a county name instead of coming up with their own and most prefecture names are settled using such substitution; third, people use old provincial names locally; (a typical example is 'Shinano Province' or 'Shinshu' which are consciously called by people in Nagano Prefecture except in the northern part of Nagano Prefecture where Nagano City is located.)

sen.j: 「旧」と付くが、それに代わる新しい国名というものがあるわけではない。
sen.e: Although it is called " old provincial name ", there is no new provincial name.
There are no new provinces although the term 'old provincial names' (kyukokumei) has the word 'old' (kyu) in it.
sen.cmt: 単数扱いであることに問題があります。
sen.e: There are no new provinces although the term 'old provincial names' (kyukokumei) has the word 'old' (kyu) in it.

sen.j: 国家としての国名との混同を避ける、もしくは戸籍や郵便などの地名の表記において、府県名が旧国名に代わるもののように使用されたために、そう呼ばれているだけである。
sen.e: The reason why we call " old province " is because we want to avoid the confusion of provincial name with the country name, and also because prefectural name has come to be used on behalf of old provincial name.

The reason the names of the provinces are called old provincial names (kyukokumei) is merely a matter of avoiding confusion between the country as a state (kuni) and the provinces which were within the country; or a reason might be that the prefecture names were used as if they supplanted the provincial names in family register and in mailing address that were used in mail.
sen.cmt: 戸籍や郵便が訳されておりません。
sen.e: The reason the names of the provinces are called old provincial names (kyukokumei) is merely a matter of avoiding confusion between the country as a state (kuni) and the provinces which were within the country; or a reason might be that the prefecture names were used as if they supplanted the provincial names in family register and in mailing address that were used in mail.

sen.j: ちなみに府県は藩に代わるものである（廃藩置県）。
sen.e: In this connection present day prefectures are the administrative divisions replacing former Hans (feudal domains). (the abolition of the han system and establishment of prefectures)
Incidentally, prefectures are that which replaced feudal domains (Haihan chiken [abolition of the han system and establishment of the prefecture system]).
sen.cmt: 2文になっているので一文にしました。
sen.e: Incidentally, prefectures are that which replaced feudal domains (Haihan chiken [abolition of the han system and establishment of the prefecture system]).

tit.cmt: 単数でないほうがいいと思います。

sen.j: 国と県の関係は地域により様々で、複数の国にまたがる県（静岡県・三重県・兵庫県など）と、複数の県にまたがる国（武蔵国・丹波国・肥前国など）の両方がある。
sen.e: Relations between provinces and prefectures are different depending on each area, and there are both cases in which they have a prefecture spreading over plural provinces (Shizuoka Prefecture, Mie Prefecture, Hyogo Prefecture, etc.) and have a province spreading over plural prefectures (Musashi Province, Tanba Province, Hizen Provimce, etc.).

The relationships between provinces and prefectures are varied depending on which areas they are located; there are prefectures which straddle plural provinces (Shizuoka Prefecture, Mie Prefecture, Hyogo Prefecture, and so on) as well as provinces that straddle plural prefectures (Musashi Province, Tanba Provinces, Bizen Provinces, and so on).
sen.cmt: they have' の意味が不明です。
sen.e: The relationships between provinces and prefectures are varied depending on which areas they are located; there are prefectures which straddle plural provinces (Shizuoka Prefecture, Mie Prefecture, Hyogo Prefecture, and so on) as well as provinces that straddle plural prefectures (Musashi Province, Tanba Provinces, Bizen Provinces, and so on).

sen.j: 国と県の範囲が一致するところ、国を分断する形で県境が引かれたところもある。
sen.e: In addition, there are an area where the extent of province and prefecture coincides with each other, and an area where prefectural border was set up cutting a province in halves.

There are cases in which the geographical area of a province accords with that of a prefecture as well there are cases in which a prefetural border is drawn in such a way in that a province is divided into two halves.
sen.cmt: 定冠詞'the'が抜けています。
sen.e: There are cases in which the geographical area of a province accords with that of a prefecture as well there are cases in which a prefetural border is drawn in such a way in that a province is divided into two halves.

sen.j: 複数の国にまたがって設けられた県では、国名が県内の地方区分として意識され、行政区分にも引き継がれることがある（例：岐阜県下部組織の飛騨国地方振興局、兵庫県庁下部組織の但馬国県民局など）。
sen.e: In some prefectures spreading over plural provinces, provincial names were taken into account as district divisions and succeeded as administrative divisions (ex. Hida Province Area Promotion Bureau as a branch of Gifu Prefecture, Tajima Province Prefectural Resident Bureau as a branch of Hyogo Prefecture).

In the prefectures where they straddle plural provinces people in the prefectural government are conscious of the names of the provinces as regional division and sometimes the names of the provinces are taken up in the administrative division; examples: Hida Province Regional Development Bureau of the Subordinate Organization of Gifu Prefecture; the Bureau for the Residents of the Tajima Province of the subordinate organization of the prefecture office of Hyogo Prefecture and so forth.
sen.cmt: 「下部組織」は「branch」ではありません。
sen.e: In the prefectures where they straddle plural provinces people in the prefectural government are conscious of the names of the provinces as regional division and sometimes the names of the provinces are taken up in the administrative division; examples: Hida Province Regional Development Bureau of the Subordinate Organization of Gifu Prefecture; the Bureau for the Residents of the Tajima Province of the subordinate organization of the prefecture office of Hyogo Prefecture and so forth.

sen.j: また、山梨県（甲斐国）や富山県（越中国）、滋賀県（近江国）、奈良県（大和国）、徳島県（阿波国）、愛媛県（伊予国）、高知県（土佐国）、熊本県（肥後国）、宮崎県（日向国）のように県と国の範囲が一致するところでは、旧国名が県の別称として用いられる。
sen.e: Moreover, in areas where extents of prefecture and province correspond with each other, such as Yamanashi Prefecture (Kai Province), Toyama Prefecture (Ettsuchu Province), Shiga Prefecture (Omi Province), Nara Prefecture (Yamato Province), Tokushima Prefecture (Awa Province), Ehime Prefecture (Iyo Province), Kochi Prefecture (Tosa Province), Kumamoto Prefecture (Higo Province), Miyazaki Prefecture (Hyuga Prevince).

In the cases where the area of a prefecture accords with that of a province, the name of the old province is used as another name of the prefecture; such prefectures include Yamanashi Prefecture (Kai Province), Toyama Prefecture (Ecchu Province), Shiga Prefecture (Omi Province), Nara Prefecture (Yamato Province), Tokushima Prefecture (Awa Province), Ehime Prefecture (Iyo Province), Kochi Prefecture (Tosa Province), Kumamoto Prefecture (Higo Province), Miyazaki Prefecture (Hyuga Province).
sen.cmt: 文が完結していません。
sen.e: In the cases where the area of a prefecture accords with that of a province, the name of the old province is used as another name of the prefecture; such prefectures include Yamanashi Prefecture (Kai Province), Toyama Prefecture (Ecchu Province), Shiga Prefecture (Omi Province), Nara Prefecture (Yamato Province), Tokushima Prefecture (Awa Province), Ehime Prefecture (Iyo Province), Kochi Prefecture (Tosa Province), Kumamoto Prefecture (Higo Province), Miyazaki Prefecture (Hyuga Province).

sen.j: 旧国名は歴史と伝統のイメージを備えているので、観光宣伝や郷土愛を喚起する場面で用いられることがある。
sen.e: Since an old province name is equipped with the image of history and tradition, it is used sometimes for the promotion of sightseeing and love for people's native place.

Sometimes the old provincial names are used for advertizing a place as the sightseeing spot or for stirring love for one's home district as the old provincial names carries with them the images of history and tradition.
sen.cmt: 「喚起する」が訳されてません。
sen.e: Sometimes the old provincial names are used for advertizing a place as the sightseeing spot or for stirring love for one's home district as the old provincial names carries with them the images of history and tradition.

tit.j: 地名に旧国名が使用される事例
tit.e: Examples that the name of old province is used for the area name
Examples in which the old provincial names are used for place names.
tit.cmt: 「地方名」と「地名」の両方の訳に「area name」を当てていますが、この２つの単語の間には意味の違いがあると思います。
tit.e: Examples in which the old provincial names are used for place names.

tit.j: 北海道の支庁名に取った旧国名
tit.e: Old province names used for branch office names in Hokkaido
The old provincial names that became the names of the subprefectures of Hokkaido.
tit.cmt: 登録されている支庁の訳は「subprefecture」です。
tit.e: The old provincial names that became the names of the subprefectures of Hokkaido.

sen.j: 根室支庁、釧路支庁、十勝支庁、石狩支庁、日高支庁、胆振支庁、後志支庁、渡島支庁。
sen.e: Nemuro Branch Office, Kushiro Branch Office, Tokachi Branch Office, Ishikari Branch Office, Hidaka Branch Office, Iburi Branch Office, Shiribeshi Branch Office, Oshima Branch Office.
Nemuro Subprefecture, Kushiro Subprefecture, Tokachi Subprefecture, Ishikari Subprefecture, Hidaka Subprefecture, Iburi Subprefecture, Shiribeshi Subprefecture, Oshima Subprefecture.
sen.cmt: 支庁の訳に問題があります。
sen.e: Nemuro Subprefecture, Kushiro Subprefecture, Tokachi Subprefecture, Ishikari Subprefecture, Hidaka Subprefecture, Iburi Subprefecture, Shiribeshi Subprefecture, Oshima Subprefecture.

sen.j: このうち日高支庁は範囲が日高国と一致する。
sen.e: Among them, the area of Hidaka Branch Office corresponds with that of Hidaka Province.
Of these, the area of the Hidaka Subprefecture accords with that of the Hidaka Province.
sen.cmt: 支庁の訳に問題があります。
sen.e: Of these, the area of the Hidaka Subprefecture accords with that of the Hidaka Province.

sen.j: なお、北海道条例において支庁の所管区域指定には旧国名が用いられているものもある。
sen.e: Besides, some area names under the jurisdiction of branch offices in Hokkaido are used with old province names.
In some of the assigned areas of jurisdiction for subprefectures based on the ordinance by the Hokkaido Government, there are cases in which the names of the old provinces are used.
sen.cmt: 「支庁」の訳に問題があります。また、「北海道条例」が訳されていません。
sen.e: In some of the assigned areas of jurisdiction for subprefectures based on the ordinance by the Hokkaido Government, there are cases in which the names of the old provinces are used.

sen.j: 市町村名に冠した旧国名 （重複の回避）
sen.e: Old province names given to the names of cities, towns and villages (avoidance of overlapping)
The old provincial names used for names of cities, towns, and villages (avoidance of overlapping)
sen.cmt: 登録されている「旧国名」の訳は「old provincial names」です。
sen.e: The old provincial names used for names of cities, towns, and villages (avoidance of overlapping)

sen.j: 明治時代に市町村を統合した時には、同じ郡の中に同じ名の町村がある場合には重複しないように改名させたが、違う郡ならそのままにした。
sen.e: When cities, towns and villages were unified in Meiji Period, if there were the towns and villages with the same name in the same county, they were ordered to change their names in order to avoid overlapping, but if towns and villages with the same name are in different counties, they were left as they were (they did not need to change their names).

When a town or village of the same name existed within the same county, the central government had the town or village to rename to avoid overlapping during which the mergers of municipalities were made in the Meiji period; yet the same names were left as they were when they existed in the different counties.
sen.cmt: 市町村合併場合、「merge」（merger) が一般的な訳語です。
sen.e: When a town or village of the same name existed within the same county, the central government had the town or village to rename to avoid overlapping during which the mergers of municipalities were made in the Meiji period; yet the same names were left as they were when they existed in the different counties.

sen.j: 市は、数が少ない事もあって、全国で同じ市名が生まれないようにさせた。
sen.e: Concerning cities, since there are fewer cities as compared with towns and villages, it was figured out not to produce cities with the same name in the whole country.
The central government worked with the local governments in the whole country to avoid overlapping of the names of the cities partly because cities were fewer in number.
sen.cmt: 時制に問題があります。また、「it」が何を指しているのか不明です。
sen.e: The central government worked with the local governments in the whole country to avoid overlapping of the names of the cities partly because cities were fewer in number.

sen.j: この原則は、市の数が増えた後代にも引き継がれた。
sen.e: This rule was succeeded in the later era.
This principal of avoiding the same names in cities was succeeded to the subsequent generations in which the numbers of cities were increased.
sen.cmt: 「市の数が増えた」が訳されていません。
sen.e: This principal of avoiding the same names in cities was succeeded to the subsequent generations in which the numbers of cities were increased.

sen.j: そして、その手法としてよく用いられるのが、旧国名を冠して重複を回避する手法である（例：常陸太田市、武蔵村山市、美濃加茂市、近江八幡市、河内長野市、大和郡山市、土佐清水市、豊後大野市）。
sen.e: And then, as the method to avoid the overlapping of city names, the method of prefixing the old province name to the city name was used (ex. Hitachi- Ota City, Musashi-Murayama City, Mino-Kamo City, Oomi-Hachiman City, Kawachi-Nagano City, Yamato-Koriyama City, Tosa-Shimizu City, Bungo-Ono City)

The method often used to avoid the existence of plural cities with the same name was to attach the old provincial names to the city names that were to be duplicated city names (examples: Hitachiota City, Musashimurayama City, Minokamo City, Omihachiman City, Kawachinagano City, Yamatokoriyama City, Tosashimizu City, Bungo-ono City).
sen.cmt: 登録されている「旧国名」の訳は「old provincial names」です。
sen.e: The method often used to avoid the existence of plural cities with the same name was to attach the old provincial names to the city names that were to be duplicated city names (examples: Hitachiota City, Musashimurayama City, Minokamo City, Omihachiman City, Kawachinagano City, Yamatokoriyama City, Tosashimizu City, Bungo-ono City).

sen.j: また、後から市制を敷いた方が市制を敷く際に旧国名を冠する事が多い。
sen.e: Besides, in many cases, the cities which were established in later era, took this prefix method.

When towns and villages reorganized themselves as a city, the ones that became a city in a later time than the one that shared the same name tended to attach the old provincial names to the city names that were to be duplicated.
sen.cmt: 「後から市制を敷いた方が」が訳されていません。
sen.e: When towns and villages reorganized themselves as a city, the ones that became a city in a later time than the one that shared the same name tended to attach the old provincial names to the city names that were to be duplicated.

sen.j: この例には、千葉県の旭市に対して愛知県の尾張旭市、新潟県の旧高田市（現在は上越市の一部）に対して岩手県の陸前高田市、奈良県の大和高田市、広島県の安芸高田市、大分県の豊後高田市などがある（このうち、安芸高田は高田市が消滅して以後の改称。
sen.e: As the above example, compared with Asahi City in Chiba Prefecture, there is Owari-Asahi City, and compared with old Takada City (now it is a part of Joetsu City), there are Rikuzen- Takada City in Iwate Prefecture, Aki- Takada City in Hiroshima Prefecture, Bungo-Takada City in Oota Prefecture (among them, Aki-Takada City was put its name after Takada City disappeared).

Such examples include Owariasahi City in Aichi Prefecture against Asahi City in Chiba Prefecture, Rikuzentakada City in Iwate Prefecture, Yamatotakada City in Nara Prefecture, Akitakada City in Hiroshima Prefecture, and Bungotakada City in Oita Prefecture against old Takada City in Niigata Prefecture (now a part of Joetsu City); of these cities Akitakada City made its name change after Takada City became a thing of the past.
sen.cmt: スペルミスがあります。また「奈良県の大和高田市」が訳されていません。
sen.e: Such examples include Owariasahi City in Aichi Prefecture against Asahi City in Chiba Prefecture, Rikuzentakada City in Iwate Prefecture, Yamatotakada City in Nara Prefecture, Akitakada City in Hiroshima Prefecture, and Bungotakada City in Oita Prefecture against old Takada City in Niigata Prefecture (now a part of Joetsu City); of these cities Akitakada City made its name change after Takada City became a thing of the past.

sen.j: 同様の事例には埼玉県の旧大宮市が消滅して以降に市制を施行した茨城県の常陸大宮市がある）。
sen.e: As the same example, there is Hitachi-Oomiya City which was established as a city after old Oomiya City disappeared.
In a similar example, there is Hitachi-Omiya City which became a city after old Omiya City, Saitama Prefecture ceased to exist.
sen.cmt: 「埼玉県」と「茨城県」が訳されていません。
sen.e: In a similar example, there is Hitachi-Omiya City which became a city after old Omiya City, Saitama Prefecture ceased to exist.

sen.j: また、特殊な例としては鹿児島県の川内市が宮城県の仙台市と同音の「せんだい」であったことから合併に際して旧国名を冠し薩摩川内市となった事例がある（周辺自治体が編入合併のイメージを嫌ったことも理由）。
sen.e: Moreover, as a special example, Sendai City in Kagoshima Prefecture was prefixed with Satsuma (old province name) and it came to be called as Satsuma- Sendai City now, since the pronunciation of its name was the same as that of Sendai in Miyagi Prefecture

As a special example, there is a case in which Sendai City in Kagoshima Prefecture became Satsumasendai City by attaching the old provincial name of Satsuma to Sendai which was homophony of Sendai City in Miyagi Prefecture although the Chinese characters that make up the word is different from that of Sendai in Miyagi Prefecture; this city name was created at the time of merger (the nearby local governments disliked the image of incorporated merger and this was one reason why Sendai City became Satsumasendai City).
sen.cmt: 「（周辺自治体が編入合併のイメージを嫌ったことも理由）」が訳されていません。
sen.e: As a special example, there is a case in which Sendai City in Kagoshima Prefecture became Satsumasendai City by attaching the old provincial name of Satsuma to Sendai which was homophony of Sendai City in Miyagi Prefecture although the Chinese characters that make up the word is different from that of Sendai in Miyagi Prefecture; this city name was created at the time of merger (the nearby local governments disliked the image of incorporated merger and this was one reason why Sendai City became Satsumasendai City).

sen.j: 和泉国（大阪府和泉）では、和泉国が「泉州」と呼ばれる事や「和」を除いても同音である事から「泉」の一字を冠している（例：滋賀県の大津市に対して泉大津市、栃木県の佐野市に対して泉佐野市）。
sen.e: Compared with Izumi City in Shiga Prefecture, there is Izumi-Otsu City in Osaka Prefecture, and compare with Sano City in Tochigi Prefecture, there is Izumi-Sano City in Osaka Prefecture.

Izumiotsu City and Izumisano City in Osaka are created against Otsu City in Shiga Prefecture and Sano City in Tochigi Prefecture respectively; One reason is that Izumi Province (Present day Izumi City) is also known as 'Senshu' and another reason is that the pronunciation of Izumi with two Chinese characters and Izumi with just one Chinese character, in which the first character is deleted, is the same; from these reasons Izumi-OtsuCity in Osaka is created against Otsu City in Shiga prefecture by adding one character from the old provincial name and Izumisano City is created against Sano City in Tochigi Prefecture for the same reasons.
sen.cmt: 訳抜けに対応しました。
sen.e: Izumiotsu City and Izumisano City in Osaka are created against Otsu City in Shiga Prefecture and Sano City in Tochigi Prefecture respectively; One reason is that Izumi Province (Present day Izumi City) is also known as 'Senshu' and another reason is that the pronunciation of Izumi with two Chinese characters and Izumi with just one Chinese character, in which the first character is deleted, is the same; from these reasons Izumi-OtsuCity in Osaka is created against Otsu City in Shiga prefecture by adding one character from the old provincial name and Izumisano City is created against Sano City in Tochigi Prefecture for the same reasons.

sen.j: ひたちなか市は勝田市と那珂湊市の合併に際して重複回避に準じた命名法則を取っているが、那珂湊漁港と区別するため旧国名を冠した常陸那珂港（旧勝田市に所在）が名称の由来となっている。
sen.e: Hitachi-Naka City followed the rule of naming to avoid the overlapping of old names when Katsuta City and Nakaminato City were combined, and the city was named after the Nakaminato Port (which is located in old Katsuta City), but prefixed the old province name Hitachi in order to distinguish the city name from the port name.Establishment of Naka City is after the establishment of Hitachinaka City.

The naming of Hitachinaka City comes from Hitachinaka Port (located in the old Katsuta City) and the name of this port has the old provincial name Hitachi in front of Naka Port to distinguish from Nakaminato Fishing Port; in this way Hitachinaka City followed the naming method of avoiding the duplication of city name when the new city name was needed to be created at the time Katsuta City and Nakaminato City merged.
sen.cmt: 「常陸那珂港」の訳が登録されている用語ではありません。また「那珂湊漁港」が訳出されていず、文全体の正確性に問題があります。
sen.e: The naming of Hitachinaka City comes from Hitachinaka Port (located in the old Katsuta City) and the name of this port has the old provincial name Hitachi in front of Naka Port to distinguish from Nakaminato Fishing Port; in this way Hitachinaka City followed the naming method of avoiding the duplication of city name when the new city name was needed to be created at the time Katsuta City and Nakaminato City merged.

sen.j: 那珂市の成立はひたちなか市の成立よりも後である。
sen.e: Establishment of Naka City is after the establishment of Hitachinaka City.
sen.cmt: ここ入るべき文が前列の文と一緒になっていたので分けました。
sen.e: Establishment of Naka City is after the establishment of Hitachinaka City.

sen.j: 市町村名に用いられた旧国名（その他）
sen.e: Old province names used for the names of cities, towns and villages (for other purposes)
Old provincial names used in the naming of cities, towns, and villages (for other purposes)
sen.cmt: 登録されている「旧国名」の訳は「old provincial names」です。
sen.e: Old provincial names used in the naming of cities, towns, and villages (for other purposes)

sen.j: 重複回避以外にも旧国名を用いる場合がある。
sen.e: There are cases to use an old province name for the purpose other than the avoidance of overlapping.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There are cases in which old provincial names are used for the purposes other than the avoidance of overlapping.
sen.cmt: 登録されている「旧国名」の訳は「old provincial names」です。
sen.e: There are cases in which old provincial names are used for the purposes other than the avoidance of overlapping.

sen.j: この場合、旧国名の一字を取ったものが多く、旧国名の方が冠する側になったものもある。
sen.e: In these cases many municipalities took one character from an old province name, while in other cases some old province names prefixed the names of municipalities.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In these cases many municipalities took one character from an old provincial name; also there were cases in which an old provincial name was prefixed the name of municipalities.
sen.cmt: 登録されている「旧国名」の訳は「old provincial names」です。
sen.e: In these cases many municipalities took one character from an old provincial name; also there were cases in which an old provincial name was prefixed the name of municipalities.

sen.j: その目的は数種に分類され、旧国内における方位を示すもの（例：東近江市、南丹市、泉南市、南あわじ市、雲南市、阿南市、西予市、日南市、南さつま市）が最も多く、国府を表すもの（例：甲府市、防府市）、地形を表すもの（例：武蔵野市、相模原市、紀の川市）、その他（例：上越市、城陽市、京丹後市）などがある。
sen.e: The points of classification for using old provincial names are as follows, (1) point of showing direction (east, west, south, north) (ex. Higashi- Omi City, Nan-Tan City, Sen-Nan City, Minami=Awaji City, Un-Nan City, A-Nan City, Sei-Yo City, Nichi-Nan City, Minami-Satsuma City), (2) point of showing old provincial capital (Kofu City, Hofu City), (3) point of showing geographical features (ex. Musashino City, Sagamihara City, Kinokawa City), (4) others (ex. Jo-Etsu City, Joyo City, Kyo-Tango City). (Note;.(1) point is most).

There are three types in terms of the purposes for using old provincial names for names of cities, towns, and villages apart from avoidance of duplication; the first type is to use old provincial names to show direction; (examples: Higashiomi City, Nantan City, Sennan City, Minamiawaji City, Unnan City, Anan City, Seiyo City, Nichinan City, Minami-Satsuma City); this type of names is largest in number; the second type is to use old provincial names to indicate that in the city there existed kokufu or the provincial capital once; (examples: Kofu City, Hofu City); third type is to use the old provincial names to show the topography of the city; (examples: Musashino City, Sagamihara City, Kinokawa City); there are also other type which does not fall into the above three types; (examples: Joetsu City, Joyo City, Kyotango City).
sen.cmt: 「points」の意味を直ちに理解することができません。
sen.e: There are three types in terms of the purposes for using old provincial names for names of cities, towns, and villages apart from avoidance of duplication; the first type is to use old provincial names to show direction; (examples: Higashiomi City, Nantan City, Sennan City, Minamiawaji City, Unnan City, Anan City, Seiyo City, Nichinan City, Minami-Satsuma City); this type of names is largest in number; the second type is to use old provincial names to indicate that in the city there existed kokufu or the provincial capital once; (examples: Kofu City, Hofu City); third type is to use the old provincial names to show the topography of the city; (examples: Musashino City, Sagamihara City, Kinokawa City); there are also other type which does not fall into the above three types; (examples: Joetsu City, Joyo City, Kyotango City).

sen.j: 上越市の「上」は「上方」（関西の旧称）の「上」と同じく京都に近い方位を意味し、この場合は「南西」にあたる。
sen.e: " Jo " of Jo-Etsu City means " Upper place " in Japanese, and in this case Upper place means the place near the capital in Kyoto. Formerly, capital was located in Kyoto. Jo-Etsu City is located among cities in the place near the capital in Echigo Province

Jo' in Joetsu City is the same as 'kami' in 'kamigata' (former name for a region of Japan referring to the cities of Kyoto and Osaka); therefore, it indicates that the direction close to Kyoto and in this case, the direction corresponds to the 'southwest.'
sen.cmt: 「上方」が正しく訳されていません。
sen.e: Jo' in Joetsu City is the same as 'kami' in 'kamigata' (former name for a region of Japan referring to the cities of Kyoto and Osaka); therefore, it indicates that the direction close to Kyoto and in this case, the direction corresponds to the 'southwest.'

sen.j: 城陽市の「陽」は「南」とほぼ同義であるが、方位以外の意味も籠められており特徴がある。
sen.e: " Yo " of Jo-Yo City has almost the same meaning as " south ", but includes another meaning (in this case " bright " ?).
The meaning of 'Yo' in Joyo City is almost synonymous with 'the south,' however, it has other meanings beside the direction; this city name is characterized by the multiple meanings of 'Yo.'
sen.cmt: 原文には、「bright」という意味が含まれていると書いてはおりません。
sen.e: The meaning of 'Yo' in Joyo City is almost synonymous with 'the south,' however, it has other meanings beside the direction; this city name is characterized by the multiple meanings of 'Yo.'

sen.j: 京丹後市は、合併6町の中に旧「丹後町」があり、他5町への配慮から重複がないにもかかわらず京都府の「京」を冠している。
sen.e: Kyo-Tango City was established by unifying 6 towns in Kyoto Prefecture and among the 6 towns there was the old " Tango town ". Paying close attention to other 5 towns, although there was no overlapping of town name, they prefixed " Kyo " of Kyoto Prefecture.

Kyotango City was formed by the merger of six towns; among the six towns the old 'Tango-cho' existed; therefore, from consideration to other five towns, 'Kyo' of Kyoto Prefecture was attached to Tango-cho from consideration to other five towns even though there existed no other Tango-cho elsewhere.
sen.cmt: 「Paying close attention」はふさわしい訳ではないと思います。
sen.e: Kyotango City was formed by the merger of six towns; among the six towns the old 'Tango-cho' existed; therefore, from consideration to other five towns, 'Kyo' of Kyoto Prefecture was attached to Tango-cho from consideration to other five towns even though there existed no other Tango-cho elsewhere.

sen.j: 京丹波町も同じような理由。
sen.e: The name of Kyo-Tanba town is due to the same reason also.
The naming of Kyotanba-cho was also made with the similar reason.
sen.cmt: 時制に問題があります。また、用語集に登録されている京丹波町の訳は「Kyotanba-cho」です。
sen.e: The naming of Kyotanba-cho was also made with the similar reason.

sen.j: 他に、2つの国の一字を合わせたものとして常総市（全域下総国）や南房総市（全域安房国）などの例もある。
sen.e: There are other examples of taking one character from old provincial name, Jo-So City was named by taking one character " So " from the name of Shimo-So Province, and Minami-Boso City was named by taking one character of " Bo (or Wa) from the name of A-Wa Province. The whole area of Jo-So City formerly belonged to Shimo-Fusa (So) Province and the whole area of Minami-Boso City belonged to A-Wa Province, respectively.
sen.cmt: 日本語原文の説明が不足しているように思われますので、理解しやすいように英文を書き加えました。
sen.e: In addition, there is a naming method in which a character is taken from two old provincial names and make a city name by combining them; Such examples include Joso City (whole area Shimousa Province) and Minamiboso City (whole area Awa Province).
sen.cmt: 正確性に問題があります。
sen.e: In addition, there is a naming method in which a character is taken from two old provincial names and make a city name by combining them; Such examples include Joso City (whole area Shimousa Province) and Minamiboso City (whole area Awa Province).

sen.j: なお、上越市の「上越」は前述の通り「越後国の上方寄り」を意味しており、「上野国と越後国」を意味する「上越」（例：上越新幹線）とは意味合いが異なる。
sen.e: Besides, " Jo-Etsu " in " Jo-Etsu City " means the area nearer Kyoto(the old capital), in Jo-Etsu Province, and its meaning is different from the meaning of " Jo-Etsu " which means " Ko-zuke Province and Echi-go Province ".(ex. Jo-Etsu Bullet Train (Shinkansen)).

As explained earlier, 'Joetsu' in Joetsu City means 'most close to kamigata (Kyoto) within Echigo Province'; therefore, the meaning of Joetsu used in Joetsu City is different from 'Joetsu' meaning 'Kozuke Province and Echigo Province' (Example: Joetsu Bullet Train).
sen.cmt: 正確性に問題があります。
sen.e: As explained earlier, 'Joetsu' in Joetsu City means 'most close to kamigata (Kyoto) within Echigo Province'; therefore, the meaning of Joetsu used in Joetsu City is different from 'Joetsu' meaning 'Kozuke Province and Echigo Province' (Example: Joetsu Bullet Train).

sen.j: 旧国名の一字を取る場合、一般に別称である「○州」の一字を取るが、例外に伊豆国（豆州）の伊東市、周防国（防州）の周南市がある。
sen.e: In case of taking one character in general, the one character from " O province " (which is another name of a province) is taken, with the exceptions of Ito City in I-Zu province (another name is Zu Province) and Shu-Nan City in Su-Ho Province (another name is Bo Province).

Every old province has another name made up with two characters beside the one we usually learn first and in case to take one character from the old provincial names to make a city name, in general it is taken from the provincial names of two-character; however, there are exceptions (example: Ito City ['I' is taken from Izu Province], Shunan City ['Shu' is taken from Suo Province; other name for Izu Province and Suo Province is Zu province and Bo Province respectively.
sen.cmt: 正確性に問題があります。
sen.e: Every old province has another name made up with two characters beside the one we usually learn first and in case to take one character from the old provincial names to make a city name, in general it is taken from the provincial names of two-character; however, there are exceptions (example: Ito City ['I' is taken from Izu Province], Shunan City ['Shu' is taken from Suo Province; other name for Izu Province and Suo Province is Zu province and Bo Province respectively.

sen.j: 仮名表記のかほく市は河北郡が由来とされるが、「加北」とも取れる。
sen.e: It is said that " Kahoku City ", which is expressed in Japanese kana alphabet, stems from Kahoku County, but it is considered as " Ka Hoku (the word means " north " in Jaanese ".)

Kahoku in Kahoku City is written in Japanese syllabary characters and not in the Chinese characters; it is thought that 'Kahoku' is derived from Kahoku County; however, it is possible to think that 'Kahoku' is derived from 'Kahoku' meaning the northern part of Kaga Province.
sen.cmt: 正確性に問題があります。
sen.e: Kahoku in Kahoku City is written in Japanese syllabary characters and not in the Chinese characters; it is thought that 'Kahoku' is derived from Kahoku County; however, it is possible to think that 'Kahoku' is derived from 'Kahoku' meaning the northern part of Kaga Province.

sen.j: 実際同市は加賀国の北端に位置する。
sen.e: In fact the City is located in the northern end of Kaga Province.
In fact the City is located in the northern end of Kaga Province.
In fact the City is located in the northern end of Kaga Province.

tit.j: 市町村名に取った旧国名
tit.e: Old Province name taken for city, town and villages
Old provincial names taken for names of cities, towns and villages
tit.cmt: 「旧国名」の訳が用語集に登録されている訳と異なります。また、「市町村名」の「名」が訳されておりません。
tit.e: Old provincial names taken for names of cities, towns and villages

sen.j: 市町村の中には、属した国の名をそのまま名乗るものがある。
sen.e: Among cities, towns and villages, there are some which took the old province names as they are.
Some cities, towns, and villages took the names of old provinces, to which they belonged, without making any changes.
sen.cmt: 正確性に問題があります。
sen.e: Some cities, towns, and villages took the names of old provinces, to which they belonged, without making any changes.

sen.j: 明治時代以前の日本には、国の中に国と同じ名を持つ郡はあっても、同じ名を持つ町や村は存在しなかったので、そのほとんどは近代以降に作られた新地名ということになる。
sen.e: In Japan before Meiji Period, even if there were counties which had the same names with provinces, there were no towns and villages which had the same names with provinces, therefore, most names of cities, towns and villages with the same names of old provinces were new ones given after modern times.

In Japan before the Meiji period there existed names of counties that were the same with the provincial names within the provinces; however there was no towns and villages that had the same names with the provincial names; therefore, it turns out that the names of towns and villages that are the same with the provincial names are almost all new place names made after the modern times.
sen.cmt: 「new ones」という表現に違和感を感じます。
sen.e: In Japan before the Meiji period there existed names of counties that were the same with the provincial names within the provinces; however there was no towns and villages that had the same names with the provincial names; therefore, it turns out that the names of towns and villages that are the same with the provincial names are almost all new place names made after the modern times.

sen.j: 旧国名を名乗る条件は特にないが、国府や一宮が存在することや、国名と同名の郡であることなどが暗黙のうちに条件とされる傾向がある。
sen.e: There are no specific conditions of using old province names for cities, towns and villages, but there are tendencies on tacit conditions that a provincial capital or a provincial shrine is located, or they belong to the same counties with the same names of their provinces.

There are no specific conditions of using old province names for cities, towns and villages, but there are tendencies on tacit conditions that a provincial capital or a provincial shrine is located, or they belong to the same counties with the same names of their provinces.

There are no specific conditions of using old province names for cities, towns and villages, but there are tendencies on tacit conditions that a provincial capital or a provincial shrine is located, or they belong to the same counties with the same names of their provinces.

sen.j: しかし、これらは次第に考慮されなくなってきており、平成の大合併期には、強引な名称決定に論争が起きた事例も少なくなかった。
sen.e: However, these conditions have not come to be considered gradually, and at the time of big consolidation in Heisei period, controversies occurred in many cases in which municipality names were forcibly decided.

However, these conditions have not come to be considered gradually, and at the time of big consolidation in Heisei period, controversies occurred in many cases in which municipality names were forcibly decided.

However, these conditions have not come to be considered gradually, and at the time of big consolidation in Heisei period, controversies occurred in many cases in which municipality names were forcibly decided.

sen.j: その論争（反論）には決まって、妥協案が他にない、というものがあり、妥協的な名称としての側面も持っていると言える。
sen.e: In some of these controversies there were no compromise plans other than giving old rovince names and it can be said that old province names as the new municipality names had the aspect of compromise.

Counterarguments always included that there is no other plan of compromise; therefore, it can be said that naming of cities, towns, and villages with old provincial names has the aspect of compromise.
sen.cmt: スペルミスがあります。
sen.e: Counterarguments always included that there is no other plan of compromise; therefore, it can be said that naming of cities, towns, and villages with old provincial names has the aspect of compromise.

sen.j: 釧路市、出雲市、北見市、備前市、長門市、美濃市、伊勢市、豊前市、日向市、和泉市、根室市、土佐市、加賀市、摂津市、播磨町が古い例で、平成年間（20世紀末）からさらに増加し、石狩市、伊豆市、伊豆の国市、甲斐市、下野市、飛騨市、越前市、伊賀市、志摩市、丹波市、淡路市、美作市、阿波市、筑後市、若狭町が加わった。
sen.e: In comparatively earlier times in modern era, in which they took provincial names as municipality names, we can cite the examples such as Kushiro City, Kitami City, Bizen City, Nagato City, Mino City, Ise City, Buzen City, Hyuga City, Izumi City, Nemuro City, Tosa City, Kaga City, Settsu City, Harima City, and since the beginning of Heisei Period (the end of 20th century), Ishikari City, Izu City, Izu no kuni City, Kai City, Shimotsuke City, Hida City, Echizen City, Iga City, Shima City, Tanba City, Awaji City, Mimasaka City, Awa City, Tsukuba City, Wakasa City were added to those examples.

Early examples include Kushiro City, Izumo City, Kitami City, Bizen City, Nagato City, Mino City, Ise City, Buzen City, Hyuga City, Izumi City, Nemuro City, Tosa City, Kaga City, Settsu City, Harima-cho; during the Heisei era (the end of 20th century) municipalities with old provincial names further increased; the examples include Ishikari City, Izu City, Izunokuni City, Kai City, Shimotsuke City, Hida City, Echizen City, Iga City, Shima City, Tanba City, Awaji City, Mimasaku City, Awa City, Chikugo City, Wakasa-cho.
sen.cmt: スペルミスがあります。
sen.e: Early examples include Kushiro City, Izumo City, Kitami City, Bizen City, Nagato City, Mino City, Ise City, Buzen City, Hyuga City, Izumi City, Nemuro City, Tosa City, Kaga City, Settsu City, Harima-cho; during the Heisei era (the end of 20th century) municipalities with old provincial names further increased; the examples include Ishikari City, Izu City, Izunokuni City, Kai City, Shimotsuke City, Hida City, Echizen City, Iga City, Shima City, Tanba City, Awaji City, Mimasaku City, Awa City, Chikugo City, Wakasa-cho.

sen.j: なお、摂津市と土佐市はそれぞれ町政施行時の名称が三島町と高岡町であり、既存の市名との重複回避が市制施行時に旧国名を採用した理由となっている。
sen.e: Besides, as for Settsu City and Tosa City, their names under the town organization in the past were Mishima Town and Takaoka Town, when they adopted municipal system, they took old provincial names in order to avoid overlapping with the existing municipal names.

Besides, as for Settsu City and Tosa City, their names under the town organization in the past were Mishima Town and Takaoka Town, when they adopted municipal system, they took old provincial names in order to avoid overlapping with the existing municipal names.

Besides, as for Settsu City and Tosa City, their names under the town organization in the past were Mishima Town and Takaoka Town, when they adopted municipal system, they took old provincial names in order to avoid overlapping with the existing municipal names.

sen.j: このような場合でも、ただ「出雲」や「長門」とだけ言えば出雲国や長門国を指すことになるので、その市町村を指すときには常に「市」や「町」を付けなければならない。
sen.e: In these cases, when they say " Izumo " or " Nagato " they mean only Izumo Province or Nagato Province, and when they point to municipality they have to put " city " to Izumo or Nagato.

When the old provincial names are adopted, 'city' or 'town' must be attached to avoid misunderstanding; for example, if someone just says 'Izumo,' or 'Nagato,' these names mean Izumo Province and Nagato Province respectively; therefore, if the speaker means Izumo City or Nagato City, he needs to speak the entire name without omitting 'city.'
sen.cmt: この文の場合、原文を直訳しただけでは、著者の伝えたいことが読者に伝わってきません。
sen.e: When the old provincial names are adopted, 'city' or 'town' must be attached to avoid misunderstanding; for example, if someone just says 'Izumo,' or 'Nagato,' these names mean Izumo Province and Nagato Province respectively; therefore, if the speaker means Izumo City or Nagato City, he needs to speak the entire name without omitting 'city.'

sen.j: 北海道の根室市・北見市・石狩市・天塩町等については旧国名を使用していた期間が短かったことから、逆に「国」を付けない場合は現存する自治体の方を指すことが多い（但し、釧路市は高知県土佐市と土佐町のケース同様、同名の釧路町と区別するために「市」を付ける）。
sen.e: As for Nemuro City, Kitami City, Ishikari City, Teshio Town etc., when they do not put " province ", in many cases they mean existing municipalities. This is because in case of Hokkaido, the period of using old provincial names was short. (However, as for Kushiro City, they put city in order to distinguish the difference from the Kushiro Town, same as in the case of Tosa City and Tosa Town in Kochi Prefecture).

In Hokkaido the old provincial names were used for only brief period of time; therefore, contrary to usual cases, in many cases the names without "province' mean existing municipalities such as in the cases of Numuro City, Kitami City, Ishikari city, Teshio-cho; however, in case of Kushiro City, addition of 'city' is required to distinguish it from the homonymous Kushiro-cho as in the case of Tosa City in Kochi Prefecture and Tosa-cho.
sen.cmt: 2文に分かれていたので一文にしました。
sen.e: In Hokkaido the old provincial names were used for only brief period of time; therefore, contrary to usual cases, in many cases the names without "province' mean existing municipalities such as in the cases of Numuro City, Kitami City, Ishikari city, Teshio-cho; however, in case of Kushiro City, addition of 'city' is required to distinguish it from the homonymous Kushiro-cho as in the case of Tosa City in Kochi Prefecture and Tosa-cho.

sen.j: 文字面を変えて実質的に旧国名を取ったものにはむつ市、いわき市、さぬき市、奥州市、甲州市がある。
sen.e: Concerning municipalities which changed characters for names and adopted old provincial names virtually, there are Mutsu City, Iwaki City, Sanuki City, Oushu City, and Koshu City.

sen.j: なお、日立市は常陸国に位置するが「常陸」の国名は「日高見国（東北地方の旧称）への道」を表す「ひたかみのくにへのみち」が「ひたち」へ転訛し、徳川光圀が現在の日立市一帯において朝日が昇る様の見事さを讃えて「日立」の当て字をしたことに由来すると言われている。
sen.e: Furthermore, Hitachi City is located in Hitachi Province, but the provincial name " Hitachi " is said to originate in the following story, that the word " Hitakaminokuni eno michi " which means " the way to Hitakami Province (old name of Northeastern area) ", was shortened to " Hitachi " and Mitsukuni TOKUGAWA, an important person in TOKUGAWA period, admired the sun rising scene in the area of Hitachi and applied characters of " Hitachi " which means sun rising.

Hitach City is located in Hitachi Province and this provincial name has its own story with it; that is, a long time ago this region was said to be 'a road to Hitakami Province (old name for the northern region of Japan; then this 'Hitakami' was shortened to 'Hitachi,' and one day Mitsukuni TOKUGAWA, the domain head of the Mito Domain, saw the rising sun in this region and praised the beautiful scene and he changed the characters which make up the provincial name from 'the province we can see the high sun' to 'the sun rising province' although the sound is the same for both names.
sen.cmt: 正確性に問題があります。

sen.e: On the other hand, in order to distinguish stations, sometimes they do so by putting railway company names, and in Joshin Dentetsu in Gunma Prefecture, they put the word " Joshu " of former provincial name to distinguish stations with the similar name. Joshu is the former provincial name of Gunma Prefecture. In old JNR and JR East Japan they put the present prefectural name to distinguish stations with similar name, for example, Gunma Fujioka station.

On the other hand, there were cases in which station names were distinguished through means of adding company names or some other words; in the case of Joshu Dentetsu in Gunma, 'Joshu' is added to Tomioka Station and the station name is made to 'Joshu Tomioka Station'; the reason for this naming lied in that if the provincial name of 'Kozuke' is added, there is a possibility of being confused with 'Ueno' (Taito-ward in Tokyo) or 'Ueno' of Ueno City; Japanese National Railways and East Japan Railway Company used neither 'Kozuke' nor 'Joshu,' following the examples cited above and made a new station name by adding the current prefecture name Gunma.

sen.j: 事業者側でもそのような扱いをしている場合があり、たとえば近畿日本鉄道では、2004年ごろまで車内放送・駅構内放送・方向幕では旧国名を省略していた（例：大和西大寺駅 → 西大寺）。
sen.e: Railway companies also, handle the matter in the same way, that is, for example, Kinki Japan railway company omitted until 2004, the old provincial names in the announcement within a train, broadcasting in a station precinct, in the destination board in a station (ex; Yamato Saidaiji station => Saidaiji).

There was a time that even some railway corporations omitted the old provincial name and called the stations with the old provincial names omitting added part; for example, in case of Kintetsu Corporation, announcements in the trains, broadcasting in the station precincts, and in the rollsigns, the old provincial names were omitted up to 2004 (an example: Yamato Saidaiji Station was called Saidaiji Station).
sen.cmt: 用語集で「近畿日本鉄道」を検索すると訳が複数出てきますが、そのなかに「Kinki Japan railway company」は含まれていません。また用語集に登録されている方向幕の訳はrollsignです。
sen.e: There was a time that even some railway corporations omitted the old provincial name and called the stations with the old provincial names omitting added part; for example, in case of Kintetsu Corporation, announcements in the trains, broadcasting in the station precincts, and in the rollsigns, the old provincial names were omitted up to 2004 (an example: Yamato Saidaiji Station was called Saidaiji Station).

sen.j: また、近鉄の高田市駅は開業当初、高田町駅であったが大和高田市が1948年に市制施行した際、既に大和高田駅が別に存在したことから敢えて旧国名の「大和」を略したままの改称に踏み切っている。
sen.e: Besides, concerning Takada-Machi station in Kinki Japan railway company, when Yamato-Takada Machi became a city in 1948, they took a bold step to the changing of the station name from Yamato-Takada-Machi to Takada-Machi with the omission of " Yamato ".

Takadashi Station of Kintetsu Corporation was Takada-cho Station when it was opened; Takada-cho became Yamatotakada City in 1948; at that time the station named Yamato-Takada Station already existed; for this reason the corporation took the bold step of changing the station name into Takadashi Station in which the old provincial name of 'Yamato' is omitted.
sen.cmt: 「高田市駅」が訳されていません。また「近鉄」の訳が登録されている用語と違います。
sen.e: Takadashi Station of Kintetsu Corporation was Takada-cho Station when it was opened; Takada-cho became Yamatotakada City in 1948; at that time the station named Yamato-Takada Station already existed; for this reason the corporation took the bold step of changing the station name into Takadashi Station in which the old provincial name of 'Yamato' is omitted.

tit.cmt: 訳が登録されている用語と違います。

sen.j: 一つの都道府県に複数の運輸支局・自動車検査登録事務所がある場合、管轄区域をあまり考慮せず、単に所在地の都市名から名称を取ることが多く、釧路・和泉の場合は、所在地が旧国名をそのまま名乗る市であったに過ぎないと言える。
sen.e: In case that there are plural Transportation branches and Car Inspection & Registration Offices, they often take names from city names in their locations and it can be said that in cases of Kushiro and Izumi, their locations only happen to be the cities which bear the names of old provincial names.
